channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description: Out today! Sensory choices as logistic classificationLogistic classification describes human and animal choices based on factors such as expected value, sensory inputs of multiple modalities, prior probabilities, overall motivation, recent actions, and brain manipulations. It bridges two established models: signal detection theory and drift diffusion. The brain uses it widely, even when it is not optimal.(https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuron.2024.06.016)

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: New paper! Propofol anesthesia causes unconsciousness by making your brain more chaotic. It does this *increasing* inhibition, weirdly enough. A collaboration between labs in The Picower and McGovern Institutes at MIT https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuron.2024.06.011#neuroscience

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: "The brain has to operate on this knifeâ€™s edge between excitability and chaos."https://news.mit.edu/2024/study-reveals-how-anesthesia-drug-induces-unconsciousnes-0715

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Academic journals see "staggering profit margins approaching 40%.... Meanwhile, academics do almost all of the substantive work to produce these articles free of charge". Then, we have to pay eye-watering sums to make our papers open access.
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/article/2024/jul/16/academic-journal-publishers-universities-price-subscriptions

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: I'm looking forward to talking to Ferris Jabr at the Greenlight Bookstore in Brooklyn tonight about his wonderful new book, "Becoming Earth." Join us! https://www.greenlightbookstore.com/event/ferris-jabr-carl-zimmer

item.title: The Transmitter
item.description: The complex of two memory proteins, rather than the individual molecules acting independently, underlie month-long memories in mice, a new study suggests.By Elissa Wellehttps://www.thetransmitter.org/memory/persistent-protein-pairing-enables-memories-to-last/?utm_source=mastodon&utm_medium=org-social&utm_campaign=20240717-persistent-protein

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description:
Writing a grant proposal. A wasp interested itself in the potential of my keyboard for stashing a stung bug to rear their young. Fortunately, I was able to persuade her that the crevices on the wooden table were a far superior choice.Genus Rhopalum (tentative).http://www.inaturalist.org/observations/229894632
#iNaturalist #Hymenoptera #entomology #wasplove

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description:
"This work should support users in deciding for an LLM ..."Indeed: NONE. The results show they all fall very short of what's required to write effective image processing scripts. Rigorous science means the authors understand what they have done and the claims they make in their papers. The Methods section is perhaps the most important section of a scientific manuscript, because it's the foundation of every statement made."Benchmarking Large Language Models for Bio-Image Analysis Code Generation"
@haesleinhuepf et al. 2024https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.04.19.590278v3#LLM #ImageProcessing

item.description: "Sex tourism is big business in the Philippines. But the consequences are long-term. Foreign men â€“ including from Australia and New Zealand â€“ are estimated to have fathered tens of thousands of children to local sex workers. Now, a trailblazing Australian-led project, is using DNA samples from these children to track down their sex-tourist fathers and demand child support."https://www.abc.net.au/news/2024-07-08/dna-helps-children-track-down-sex-tourist-fathers/104069808 #audio #SexTourism #Philippines #Australia #DNA #ChildSupport
